definition: Park Ji-sung (1981-), South Korean former footballer, played for Manchester United (2005-2012)
surname Piao/Korean surname (Park, Pak, or Bak)/also pr. [Pu2]

sentences.english: Park has sometimes been criticized for aimless running.
sentences.chinese: 朴智星有時被批評他的無目的的跑動。

sentences.english: Goalscoring aside, Park is pleased with his current form, as well as the team's.
sentences.chinese: 不提進球，朴智星對自己和球隊最近的狀態感到滿意。

sentences.english: I think thats how Evra repays the kindness Ji has given him.
sentences.chinese: 我想這就是他報答朴智星的方式吧。

sentences.english: "Obertan and Valencia are good players, " Park said.
sentences.chinese: “奧貝坦和巴倫西亞都是很好的球員，”朴智星說。

sentences.english: "Unfortunately we will lose him after 26 December, " added the boss.
sentences.chinese: “很不幸，我們將在聖誕節後失去朴智星，”老闆說。

sentences.english: Sometimes, he invites Ji to his house and they spend time together.
sentences.chinese: 有時候他也會請朴智星到他家坐坐。
“我很高興，”朴智星告訴曼聯電視。

sentences.english: Can other Asian players succeed at Old Trafford, as Ji-sung Park has done?
sentences.chinese: 別的亞洲球員也能像朴智星那樣在曼聯取得成功嗎？

sentences.english: Defending, mostly — one of the greatest attacking talents on the planet was modelling his game on Park Ji Sung.
sentences.chinese: 這個星球上最牛的攻擊手之一幾乎成了第二個朴智星。

definition: Hao Haidong (1970-), former Chinese soccer player
Sun Jihai (1977-), Chinese footballer, played for Manchester City (2002-2008)
middle period of a tripartite provincial exam (in former times)/midfield/mid-court (in sports)/half-time/intermission half-way through a performance
